title: Floating point remainder in `no_std` causes linker error

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
#![no_std]
#![no_main]

fn identity(x: f64) {
    // turn off constant folding
    x
}

#[no_mangle]
pub extern "C" fn foo() {
    1.0 % identity(2.0)
}
```

I expected to see this happen: should either compile and link correctly, or give a compiler error (something like "fmod not supported in `no_std`, please use the `libm` crate")

Instead, this happened: the code compiles, but when linking into other programs (in my case a C program), the linker reports "unresolved external symbol `fmod` referenced in function foo".

I'm currently using `libm` directly as a workaround.
